title.rendered: “Decoding the IDF’s Strategic Strikes: A Behind-the-Scenes Look at Israel’s Swift Action Against Hezbollah in Lebanon”

content.rendered:
IDF Spokesperson:

Approximately 10 targets were attacked in succession: The IDF attacked widely Hezbollah’s terror targets in Lebanon, including buildings in which terrorists were staying.

Earlier today, an aircraft of the Air Force attacked a terrorist cell in the Cana area of Lebanon, which was on their way to immediately carry out a terror attack against Israeli territory.

Simultaneously, fighter jets from the Air Force extensively attacked and destroyed a series of Hezbollah terrorist organization’s targets in Lebanon throughout the day.

Among the targets that were attacked, a military building and an observation post in the Ayta al-Shaab area, an observation post and terror infrastructure in the Mis al-Jabal area, a military building in the Kfar Kila area, and two military buildings in the Anqura and Hula areas, where terrorists were staying.

Over the past few hours, IDF forces have attacked to remove the threat in several areas in Lebanon.

Attached is documentation from the attacks: https://bit.ly/4dWpV67
